subject: Re: [junit] Reloading tests with text runner?

messageBody:
Hi,
Good point to note. I have similar setup for running Testcases from
JUnit SwingUI. Even through I have checked "Reload classes every run"
It doesnot not bother to reload the classes for next run. I have packed all
my class files inside a jar and run the tests. Changing the testcase and
updating jar files and then rerunning the same testcase doesnot reflect the
the changes. I have to explicitly stop the UI and then do rerun.

WHY???

Thanks.

Ranjeet Sahay



Ives Aerts wrote:

> We are using JUnit on an embedded platform where:
> + restarting the VM is expensive
> + we can only use the junit.textui.TestRunner
> + we can update jar files on the platform and restart tests by
> attaching to the (running VM) and calling TestRunner.run()
>
> Is it possible to make the textui TestRunner use a new classloader for
> each invocation so that tests and tested classes are reloaded from the
> updated jar files?
>
> Cheers,
> -Ives
